intro: Trichopus zeylanicus var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trichopus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
